00001 /**
00002  * \file Geodesic.cpp
00003  * \brief Implementation for GeographicLib::Geodesic class
00004  *
00005  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2009, 2010, 2011) <charles@karney.com>
00006  * and licensed under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00007  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00008  *
00009  * This is a reformulation of the geodesic problem.  The notation is as
00010  * follows:
00011  * - at a general point (no suffix or 1 or 2 as suffix)
00012  *   - phi = latitude
00013  *   - beta = latitude on auxiliary sphere
00014  *   - omega = longitude on auxiliary sphere
00015  *   - lambda = longitude
00016  *   - alpha = azimuth of great circle
00017  *   - sigma = arc length along greate circle
00018  *   - s = distance
00019  *   - tau = scaled distance (= sigma at multiples of pi/2)
00020  * - at northwards equator crossing
00021  *   - beta = phi = 0
00022  *   - omega = lambda = 0
00023  *   - alpha = alpha0
00024  *   - sigma = s = 0
00025  * - a 12 suffix means a difference, e.g., s12 = s2 - s1.
00026  * - s and c prefixes mean sin and cos
00027  **********************************************************************/
00028 
00029 #include <GeographicLib/Geodesic.hpp>
00030 #include <GeographicLib/GeodesicLine.hpp>
00031 
00032 #define GEOGRAPHICLIB_GEODESIC_CPP "$Id: ac5347a9b8a486191d736b6e1025d05779a6e8d6 $"

00039   using namespace std;
00040 
00041   // Underflow guard.  We require
00042   //   tiny_ * epsilon() > 0
00043   //   tiny_ + epsilon() == epsilon()
00044   const Math::real Geodesic::tiny_ = sqrt(numeric_limits<real>::min());
00045   const Math::real Geodesic::tol0_ = numeric_limits<real>::epsilon();
00046   // Increase multiplier in defn of tol1_ from 100 to 200 to fix inverse case
00047   // 52.784459512564 0 -52.784459512563990912 179.634407464943777557
00048   // which otherwise failed for Visual Studio 10 (Release and Debug)
00049   const Math::real Geodesic::tol1_ = 200 * tol0_;
00050   const Math::real Geodesic::tol2_ = sqrt(numeric_limits<real>::epsilon());
00051   const Math::real Geodesic::xthresh_ = 1000 * tol2_;
00052 
00053   Geodesic::Geodesic(real a, real f)
00054     : _a(a)
00055     , _f(f <= 1 ? f : 1/f)
00056     , _f1(1 - _f)
00057     , _e2(_f * (2 - _f))
00058     , _ep2(_e2 / Math::sq(_f1))       // e2 / (1 - e2)
00059     , _n(_f / ( 2 - _f))
00060     , _b(_a * _f1)
00061     , _c2((Math::sq(_a) + Math::sq(_b) *
00062            (_e2 == 0 ? 1 :
00063             (_e2 > 0 ? Math::atanh(sqrt(_e2)) : atan(sqrt(-_e2))) /
00064             sqrt(abs(_e2))))/2) // authalic radius squared
00065     , _etol2(tol2_ / max(real(0.1), sqrt(abs(_e2))))
00066   {
00067     if (!(Math::isfinite(_a) && _a > 0))
00068       throw GeographicErr("Major radius is not positive");
00069     if (!(Math::isfinite(_b) && _b > 0))
00070       throw GeographicErr("Minor radius is not positive");
00071     A3coeff();
00072     C3coeff();
00073     C4coeff();
00074   }

00077                                  Constants::WGS84_f<real>());

00079   Math::real Geodesic::SinCosSeries(bool sinp,
00080                                     real sinx, real cosx,
00081                                     const real c[], int n) throw() {
00082     // Evaluate
00083     // y = sinp ? sum(c[i] * sin( 2*i    * x), i, 1, n) :
00084     //            sum(c[i] * cos((2*i+1) * x), i, 0, n-1) :
00085     // using Clenshaw summation.  N.B. c[0] is unused for sin series
00086     // Approx operation count = (n + 5) mult and (2 * n + 2) add
00087     c += (n + sinp);            // Point to one beyond last element
00088     real
00089       ar = 2 * (cosx - sinx) * (cosx + sinx), // 2 * cos(2 * x)
00090       y0 = n & 1 ? *--c : 0, y1 = 0;          // accumulators for sum
00091     // Now n is even
00092     n /= 2;
00093     while (n--) {
00094       // Unroll loop x 2, so accumulators return to their original role
00095       y1 = ar * y0 - y1 + *--c;
00096       y0 = ar * y1 - y0 + *--c;
00097     }
00098     return sinp
00099       ? 2 * sinx * cosx * y0    // sin(2 * x) * y0
00100       : cosx * (y0 - y1);       // cos(x) * (y0 - y1)
00101   }

00104     const throw() {
00105     return GeodesicLine(*this, lat1, lon1, azi1, caps);
00106   }

00108   Math::real Geodesic::GenDirect(real lat1, real lon1, real azi1,
00109                                  bool arcmode, real s12_a12, unsigned outmask,
00110                                  real& lat2, real& lon2, real& azi2,
00111                                  real& s12, real& m12, real& M12, real& M21,
00112                                  real& S12) const throw() {
00113     return GeodesicLine(*this, lat1, lon1, azi1,
00114                         // Automatically supply DISTANCE_IN if necessary
00115                         outmask | (arcmode ? NONE : DISTANCE_IN))
00116       .                         // Note the dot!
00117       GenPosition(arcmode, s12_a12, outmask,
00118                   lat2, lon2, azi2, s12, m12, M12, M21, S12);
00119   }

00121   Math::real Geodesic::GenInverse(real lat1, real lon1, real lat2, real lon2,
00122                                   unsigned outmask,
00123                                   real& s12, real& azi1, real& azi2,
00124                                   real& m12, real& M12, real& M21, real& S12)
00125     const throw() {
00126     outmask &= OUT_ALL;
00127     lon1 = AngNormalize(lon1);
00128     real lon12 = AngNormalize(AngNormalize(lon2) - lon1);
00129     // If very close to being on the same meridian, then make it so.
00130     // Not sure this is necessary...
00131     lon12 = AngRound(lon12);
00132     // Make longitude difference positive.
00133     int lonsign = lon12 >= 0 ? 1 : -1;
00134     lon12 *= lonsign;
00135     if (lon12 == 180)
00136       lonsign = 1;
00137     // If really close to the equator, treat as on equator.
00138     lat1 = AngRound(lat1);
00139     lat2 = AngRound(lat2);
00140     // Swap points so that point with higher (abs) latitude is point 1
00141     int swapp = abs(lat1) >= abs(lat2) ? 1 : -1;
00142     if (swapp < 0) {
00143       lonsign *= -1;
00144       swap(lat1, lat2);
00145     }
00146     // Make lat1 <= 0
00147     int latsign = lat1 < 0 ? 1 : -1;
00148     lat1 *= latsign;
00149     lat2 *= latsign;
00150     // Now we have
00151     //
00152     //     0 <= lon12 <= 180
00153     //     -90 <= lat1 <= 0
00154     //     lat1 <= lat2 <= -lat1
00155     //
00156     // longsign, swapp, latsign register the transformation to bring the
00157     // coordinates to this canonical form.  In all cases, 1 means no change was
00158     // made.  We make these transformations so that there are few cases to
00159     // check, e.g., on verifying quadrants in atan2.  In addition, this
00160     // enforces some symmetries in the results returned.
00161 
00162     real phi, sbet1, cbet1, sbet2, cbet2, s12x, m12x;
00163 
00164     phi = lat1 * Math::degree<real>();
00165     // Ensure cbet1 = +epsilon at poles
00166     sbet1 = _f1 * sin(phi);
00167     cbet1 = lat1 == -90 ? tiny_ : cos(phi);
00168     SinCosNorm(sbet1, cbet1);
00169 
00170     phi = lat2 * Math::degree<real>();
00171     // Ensure cbet2 = +epsilon at poles
00172     sbet2 = _f1 * sin(phi);
00173     cbet2 = abs(lat2) == 90 ? tiny_ : cos(phi);
00174     SinCosNorm(sbet2, cbet2);
00175 
00176     // If cbet1 < -sbet1, then cbet2 - cbet1 is a sensitive measure of the
00177     // |bet1| - |bet2|.  Alternatively (cbet1 >= -sbet1), abs(sbet2) + sbet1 is
00178     // a better measure.  This logic is used in assigning calp2 in Lambda12.
00179     // Sometimes these quantities vanish and in that case we force bet2 = +/-
00180     // bet1 exactly.  An example where is is necessary is the inverse problem
00181     // 48.522876735459 0 -48.52287673545898293 179.599720456223079643
00182     // which failed with Visual Studio 10 (Release and Debug)
00183 
00184     if (cbet1 < -sbet1) {
00185       if (cbet2 == cbet1)
00186         sbet2 = sbet2 < 0 ? sbet1 : -sbet1;
00187     } else {
00188       if (abs(sbet2) == -sbet1)
00189         cbet2 = cbet1;
00190     }
00191 
00192     real
00193       lam12 = lon12 * Math::degree<real>(),
00194       slam12 = lon12 == 180 ? 0 : sin(lam12),
00195       clam12 = cos(lam12);      // lon12 == 90 isn't interesting
00196 
00197     real a12, sig12, calp1, salp1, calp2, salp2;
00198     // index zero elements of these arrays are unused
00199     real C1a[nC1_ + 1], C2a[nC2_ + 1], C3a[nC3_];
00200 
00201     bool meridian = lat1 == -90 || slam12 == 0;
00202 
00203     if (meridian) {
00204 
00205       // Endpoints are on a single full meridian, so the geodesic might lie on
00206       // a meridian.
00207 
00208       calp1 = clam12; salp1 = slam12; // Head to the target longitude
00209       calp2 = 1; salp2 = 0;           // At the target we're heading north
00210 
00211       real
00212         // tan(bet) = tan(sig) * cos(alp)
00213         ssig1 = sbet1, csig1 = calp1 * cbet1,
00214         ssig2 = sbet2, csig2 = calp2 * cbet2;
00215 
00216       // sig12 = sig2 - sig1
00217       sig12 = atan2(max(csig1 * ssig2 - ssig1 * csig2, real(0)),
00218                     csig1 * csig2 + ssig1 * ssig2);
00219       {
00220         real dummy;
00221         Lengths(_n, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00222                 cbet1, cbet2, s12x, m12x, dummy,
00223                 (outmask & GEODESICSCALE) != 0U, M12, M21, C1a, C2a);
00224       }
00225       // Add the check for sig12 since zero length geodesics might yield m12 <
00226       // 0.  Test case was
00227       //
00228       //    echo 20.001 0 20.001 0 | Geod -i
00229       //
00230       // In fact, we will have sig12 > pi/2 for meridional geodesic which is
00231       // not a shortest path.
00232       if (sig12 < 1 || m12x >= 0) {
00233         m12x *= _a;
00234         s12x *= _b;
00235         a12 = sig12 / Math::degree<real>();
00236       } else
00237         // m12 < 0, i.e., prolate and too close to anti-podal
00238         meridian = false;
00239     }
00240 
00241     real omg12;
00242     if (!meridian &&
00243         sbet1 == 0 &&   // and sbet2 == 0
00244         // Mimic the way Lambda12 works with calp1 = 0
00245         (_f <= 0 || lam12 <= Math::pi<real>() - _f * Math::pi<real>())) {
00246 
00247       // Geodesic runs along equator
00248       calp1 = calp2 = 0; salp1 = salp2 = 1;
00249       s12x = _a * lam12;
00250       m12x = _b * sin(lam12 / _f1);
00251       if (outmask & GEODESICSCALE)
00252         M12 = M21 = cos(lam12 / _f1);
00253       a12 = lon12 / _f1;
00254       sig12 = omg12 = lam12 / _f1;
00255 
00256     } else if (!meridian) {
00257 
00258       // Now point1 and point2 belong within a hemisphere bounded by a
00259       // meridian and geodesic is neither meridional or equatorial.
00260 
00261       // Figure a starting point for Newton's method
00262       sig12 = InverseStart(sbet1, cbet1, sbet2, cbet2,
00263                            lam12,
00264                            salp1, calp1, salp2, calp2,
00265                            C1a, C2a);
00266 
00267       if (sig12 >= 0) {
00268         // Short lines (InverseStart sets salp2, calp2)
00269         real w1 = sqrt(1 - _e2 * Math::sq(cbet1));
00270         s12x = sig12 * _a * w1;
00271         m12x = Math::sq(w1) * _a / _f1 * sin(sig12 * _f1 / w1);
00272         if (outmask & GEODESICSCALE)
00273           M12 = M21 = cos(sig12 * _f1 / w1);
00274         a12 = sig12 / Math::degree<real>();
00275         omg12 = lam12 / w1;
00276       } else {
00277 
00278         // Newton's method
00279         real ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2, eps;
00280         real ov = 0;
00281         unsigned numit = 0;
00282         for (unsigned trip = 0; numit < maxit_; ++numit) {
00283           real dv;
00284           real v = Lambda12(sbet1, cbet1, sbet2, cbet2, salp1, calp1,
00285                             salp2, calp2, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00286                             eps, omg12, trip < 1, dv, C1a, C2a, C3a) - lam12;
00287           if (!(abs(v) > tiny_) || !(trip < 1)) {
00288             if (!(abs(v) <= max(tol1_, ov)))
00289               numit = maxit_;
00290             break;
00291           }
00292           real
00293             dalp1 = -v/dv;
00294           real
00295             sdalp1 = sin(dalp1), cdalp1 = cos(dalp1),
00296             nsalp1 = salp1 * cdalp1 + calp1 * sdalp1;
00297           calp1 = calp1 * cdalp1 - salp1 * sdalp1;
00298           salp1 = max(real(0), nsalp1);
00299           SinCosNorm(salp1, calp1);
00300           // In some regimes we don't get quadratic convergence because slope
00301           // -> 0.  So use convergence conditions based on epsilon instead of
00302           // sqrt(epsilon).  The first criterion is a test on abs(v) against
00303           // 100 * epsilon.  The second takes credit for an anticipated
00304           // reduction in abs(v) by v/ov (due to the latest update in alp1) and
00305           // checks this against epsilon.
00306           if (!(abs(v) >= tol1_ && Math::sq(v) >= ov * tol0_)) ++trip;
00307           ov = abs(v);
00308         }
00309 
00310         if (numit >= maxit_) {
00311           // Signal failure.
00312           if (outmask & DISTANCE)
00313             s12 = Math::NaN<real>();
00314           if (outmask & AZIMUTH)
00315             azi1 = azi2 = Math::NaN<real>();
00316           if (outmask & REDUCEDLENGTH)
00317             m12 = Math::NaN<real>();
00318           if (outmask & GEODESICSCALE)
00319             M12 = M21 = Math::NaN<real>();
00320           if (outmask & AREA)
00321             S12 = Math::NaN<real>();
00322           return Math::NaN<real>();
00323         }
00324 
00325         {
00326           real dummy;
00327           Lengths(eps, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00328                   cbet1, cbet2, s12x, m12x, dummy,
00329                   (outmask & GEODESICSCALE) != 0U, M12, M21, C1a, C2a);
00330         }
00331         m12x *= _a;
00332         s12x *= _b;
00333         a12 = sig12 / Math::degree<real>();
00334         omg12 = lam12 - omg12;
00335       }
00336     }
00337 
00338     if (outmask & DISTANCE)
00339       s12 = 0 + s12x;           // Convert -0 to 0
00340 
00341     if (outmask & REDUCEDLENGTH)
00342       m12 = 0 + m12x;           // Convert -0 to 0
00343 
00344     if (outmask & AREA) {
00345       real
00346         // From Lambda12: sin(alp1) * cos(bet1) = sin(alp0)
00347         salp0 = salp1 * cbet1,
00348         calp0 = Math::hypot(calp1, salp1 * sbet1); // calp0 > 0
00349       real alp12;
00350       if (calp0 != 0 && salp0 != 0) {
00351         real
00352           // From Lambda12: tan(bet) = tan(sig) * cos(alp)
00353           ssig1 = sbet1, csig1 = calp1 * cbet1,
00354           ssig2 = sbet2, csig2 = calp2 * cbet2,
00355           k2 = Math::sq(calp0) * _ep2,
00356           // Multiplier = a^2 * e^2 * cos(alpha0) * sin(alpha0).
00357           A4 = Math::sq(_a) * calp0 * salp0 * _e2;
00358         SinCosNorm(ssig1, csig1);
00359         SinCosNorm(ssig2, csig2);
00360         real C4a[nC4_];
00361         C4f(k2, C4a);
00362         real
00363           B41 = SinCosSeries(false, ssig1, csig1, C4a, nC4_),
00364           B42 = SinCosSeries(false, ssig2, csig2, C4a, nC4_);
00365         S12 = A4 * (B42 - B41);
00366       } else
00367         // Avoid problems with indeterminate sig1, sig2 on equator
00368         S12 = 0;
00369 
00370       if (!meridian &&
00371           omg12 < real(0.75) * Math::pi<real>() && // Long difference too big
00372           sbet2 - sbet1 < real(1.75)) {            // Lat difference too big
00373         // Use tan(Gamma/2) = tan(omg12/2)
00374         // * (tan(bet1/2)+tan(bet2/2))/(1+tan(bet1/2)*tan(bet2/2))
00375         // with tan(x/2) = sin(x)/(1+cos(x))
00376         real
00377           somg12 = sin(omg12), domg12 = 1 + cos(omg12),
00378           dbet1 = 1 + cbet1, dbet2 = 1 + cbet2;
00379         alp12 = 2 * atan2( somg12 * ( sbet1 * dbet2 + sbet2 * dbet1 ),
00380                            domg12 * ( sbet1 * sbet2 + dbet1 * dbet2 ) );
00381       } else {
00382         // alp12 = alp2 - alp1, used in atan2 so no need to normalize
00383         real
00384           salp12 = salp2 * calp1 - calp2 * salp1,
00385           calp12 = calp2 * calp1 + salp2 * salp1;
00386         // The right thing appears to happen if alp1 = +/-180 and alp2 = 0, viz
00387         // salp12 = -0 and alp12 = -180.  However this depends on the sign
00388         // being attached to 0 correctly.  The following ensures the correct
00389         // behavior.
00390         if (salp12 == 0 && calp12 < 0) {
00391           salp12 = tiny_ * calp1;
00392           calp12 = -1;
00393         }
00394         alp12 = atan2(salp12, calp12);
00395       }
00396       S12 += _c2 * alp12;
00397       S12 *= swapp * lonsign * latsign;
00398       // Convert -0 to 0
00399       S12 += 0;
00400     }
00401 
00402     // Convert calp, salp to azimuth accounting for lonsign, swapp, latsign.
00403     if (swapp < 0) {
00404       swap(salp1, salp2);
00405       swap(calp1, calp2);
00406       if (outmask & GEODESICSCALE)
00407         swap(M12, M21);
00408     }
00409 
00410     salp1 *= swapp * lonsign; calp1 *= swapp * latsign;
00411     salp2 *= swapp * lonsign; calp2 *= swapp * latsign;
00412 
00413     if (outmask & AZIMUTH) {
00414       // minus signs give range [-180, 180). 0- converts -0 to +0.
00415       azi1 = 0 - atan2(-salp1, calp1) / Math::degree<real>();
00416       azi2 = 0 - atan2(-salp2, calp2) / Math::degree<real>();
00417     }
00418 
00419     // Returned value in [0, 180]
00420     return a12;
00421   }
00422 
00423   void Geodesic::Lengths(real eps, real sig12,
00424                          real ssig1, real csig1, real ssig2, real csig2,
00425                          real cbet1, real cbet2,
00426                          real& s12b, real& m12a, real& m0,
00427                          bool scalep, real& M12, real& M21,
00428                          // Scratch areas of the right size
00429                          real C1a[], real C2a[]) const throw() {
00430     // Return m12a = (reduced length)/_a; also calculate s12b = distance/_b,
00431     // and m0 = coefficient of secular term in expression for reduced length.
00432     C1f(eps, C1a);
00433     C2f(eps, C2a);
00434     real
00435       A1m1 = A1m1f(eps),
00436       AB1 = (1 + A1m1) * (SinCosSeries(true, ssig2, csig2, C1a, nC1_) -
00437                           SinCosSeries(true, ssig1, csig1, C1a, nC1_)),
00438       A2m1 = A2m1f(eps),
00439       AB2 = (1 + A2m1) * (SinCosSeries(true, ssig2, csig2, C2a, nC2_) -
00440                           SinCosSeries(true, ssig1, csig1, C2a, nC2_)),
00441       cbet1sq = Math::sq(cbet1),
00442       cbet2sq = Math::sq(cbet2),
00443       w1 = sqrt(1 - _e2 * cbet1sq),
00444       w2 = sqrt(1 - _e2 * cbet2sq),
00445       // Make sure it's OK to have repeated dummy arguments
00446       m0x = A1m1 - A2m1,
00447       J12 = m0x * sig12 + (AB1 - AB2);
00448     m0 = m0x;
00449     // Missing a factor of _a.
00450     // Add parens around (csig1 * ssig2) and (ssig1 * csig2) to ensure accurate
00451     // cancellation in the case of coincident points.
00452     m12a = (w2 * (csig1 * ssig2) - w1 * (ssig1 * csig2))
00453       - _f1 * csig1 * csig2 * J12;
00454     // Missing a factor of _b
00455     s12b =  (1 + A1m1) * sig12 + AB1;
00456     if (scalep) {
00457       real csig12 = csig1 * csig2 + ssig1 * ssig2;
00458       J12 *= _f1;
00459       M12 = csig12 + (_e2 * (cbet1sq - cbet2sq) * ssig2 / (w1 + w2)
00460                       - csig2 * J12) * ssig1 / w1;
00461       M21 = csig12 - (_e2 * (cbet1sq - cbet2sq) * ssig1 / (w1 + w2)
00462                       - csig1 * J12) * ssig2 / w2;
00463     }
00464   }
00465 
00466   Math::real Geodesic::Astroid(real x, real y) throw() {
00467     // Solve k^4+2*k^3-(x^2+y^2-1)*k^2-2*y^2*k-y^2 = 0 for positive root k.
00468     // This solution is adapted from Geocentric::Reverse.
00469     real k;
00470     real
00471       p = Math::sq(x),
00472       q = Math::sq(y),
00473       r = (p + q - 1) / 6;
00474     if ( !(q == 0 && r <= 0) ) {
00475       real
00476         // Avoid possible division by zero when r = 0 by multiplying equations
00477         // for s and t by r^3 and r, resp.
00478         S = p * q / 4,            // S = r^3 * s
00479         r2 = Math::sq(r),
00480         r3 = r * r2,
00481         // The discrimant of the quadratic equation for T3.  This is zero on
00482         // the evolute curve p^(1/3)+q^(1/3) = 1
00483         disc =  S * (S + 2 * r3);
00484       real u = r;
00485       if (disc >= 0) {
00486         real T3 = S + r3;
00487         // Pick the sign on the sqrt to maximize abs(T3).  This minimizes loss
00488         // of precision due to cancellation.  The result is unchanged because
00489         // of the way the T is used in definition of u.
00490         T3 += T3 < 0 ? -sqrt(disc) : sqrt(disc); // T3 = (r * t)^3
00491         // N.B. cbrt always returns the real root.  cbrt(-8) = -2.
00492         real T = Math::cbrt(T3); // T = r * t
00493         // T can be zero; but then r2 / T -> 0.
00494         u += T + (T != 0 ? r2 / T : 0);
00495       } else {
00496         // T is complex, but the way u is defined the result is real.
00497         real ang = atan2(sqrt(-disc), -(S + r3));
00498         // There are three possible cube roots.  We choose the root which
00499         // avoids cancellation.  Note that disc < 0 implies that r < 0.
00500         u += 2 * r * cos(ang / 3);
00501       }
00502       real
00503         v = sqrt(Math::sq(u) + q),    // guaranteed positive
00504         // Avoid loss of accuracy when u < 0.
00505         uv = u < 0 ? q / (v - u) : u + v, // u+v, guaranteed positive
00506         w = (uv - q) / (2 * v);           // positive?
00507       // Rearrange expression for k to avoid loss of accuracy due to
00508       // subtraction.  Division by 0 not possible because uv > 0, w >= 0.
00509       k = uv / (sqrt(uv + Math::sq(w)) + w);   // guaranteed positive
00510     } else {               // q == 0 && r <= 0
00511       // y = 0 with |x| <= 1.  Handle this case directly.
00512       // for y small, positive root is k = abs(y)/sqrt(1-x^2)
00513       k = 0;
00514     }
00515     return k;
00516   }
00517 
00518   Math::real Geodesic::InverseStart(real sbet1, real cbet1,
00519                                     real sbet2, real cbet2,
00520                                     real lam12,
00521                                     real& salp1, real& calp1,
00522                                     // Only updated if return val >= 0
00523                                     real& salp2, real& calp2,
00524                                     // Scratch areas of the right size
00525                                     real C1a[], real C2a[]) const throw() {
00526     // Return a starting point for Newton's method in salp1 and calp1 (function
00527     // value is -1).  If Newton's method doesn't need to be used, return also
00528     // salp2 and calp2 and function value is sig12.
00529     real
00530       sig12 = -1,               // Return value
00531       // bet12 = bet2 - bet1 in [0, pi); bet12a = bet2 + bet1 in (-pi, 0]
00532       sbet12 = sbet2 * cbet1 - cbet2 * sbet1,
00533       cbet12 = cbet2 * cbet1 + sbet2 * sbet1;
00534     // Volatile declaration needed to fix inverse cases
00535     // 88.202499451857 0 -88.202499451857 179.981022032992859592
00536     // 89.262080389218 0 -89.262080389218 179.992207982775375662
00537     // 89.333123580033 0 -89.333123580032997687 179.99295812360148422
00538     // which otherwise fail with g++ 4.4.4 x86 -O3
00539     volatile real sbet12a = sbet2 * cbet1;
00540     sbet12a += cbet2 * sbet1;
00541 
00542     bool shortline = cbet12 >= 0 && sbet12 < real(0.5) &&
00543       lam12 <= Math::pi<real>() / 6;
00544     real
00545       omg12 = shortline ? lam12 / sqrt(1 - _e2 * Math::sq(cbet1)) : lam12,
00546       somg12 = sin(omg12), comg12 = cos(omg12);
00547 
00548     salp1 = cbet2 * somg12;
00549     calp1 = comg12 >= 0 ?
00550       sbet12 + cbet2 * sbet1 * Math::sq(somg12) / (1 + comg12) :
00551       sbet12a - cbet2 * sbet1 * Math::sq(somg12) / (1 - comg12);
00552 
00553     real
00554       ssig12 = Math::hypot(salp1, calp1),
00555       csig12 = sbet1 * sbet2 + cbet1 * cbet2 * comg12;
00556 
00557     if (shortline && ssig12 < _etol2) {
00558       // really short lines
00559       salp2 = cbet1 * somg12;
00560       calp2 = sbet12 - cbet1 * sbet2 * Math::sq(somg12) / (1 + comg12);
00561       SinCosNorm(salp2, calp2);
00562       // Set return value
00563       sig12 = atan2(ssig12, csig12);
00564     } else if (csig12 >= 0 ||
00565                ssig12 >= 3 * abs(_f) * Math::pi<real>() * Math::sq(cbet1)) {
00566       // Nothing to do, zeroth order spherical approximation is OK
00567     } else {
00568       // Scale lam12 and bet2 to x, y coordinate system where antipodal point
00569       // is at origin and singular point is at y = 0, x = -1.
00570       real y, lamscale, betscale;
00571       // Volatile declaration needed to fix inverse case
00572       // 56.320923501171 0 -56.320923501171 179.664747671772880215
00573       // which otherwise fails with g++ 4.4.4 x86 -O3
00574       volatile real x;
00575       if (_f >= 0) {            // In fact f == 0 does not get here
00576         // x = dlong, y = dlat
00577         {
00578           real
00579             k2 = Math::sq(sbet1) * _ep2,
00580             eps = k2 / (2 * (1 + sqrt(1 + k2)) + k2);
00581           lamscale = _f * cbet1 * A3f(eps) * Math::pi<real>();
00582         }
00583         betscale = lamscale * cbet1;
00584 
00585         x = (lam12 - Math::pi<real>()) / lamscale;
00586         y = sbet12a / betscale;
00587       } else {                  // _f < 0
00588         // x = dlat, y = dlong
00589         real
00590           cbet12a = cbet2 * cbet1 - sbet2 * sbet1,
00591           bet12a = atan2(sbet12a, cbet12a);
00592         real m12a, m0, dummy;
00593         // In the case of lon12 = 180, this repeats a calculation made in
00594         // Inverse.
00595         Lengths(_n, Math::pi<real>() + bet12a, sbet1, -cbet1, sbet2, cbet2,
00596                 cbet1, cbet2, dummy, m12a, m0, false,
00597                 dummy, dummy, C1a, C2a);
00598         x = -1 + m12a/(_f1 * cbet1 * cbet2 * m0 * Math::pi<real>());
00599         betscale = x < -real(0.01) ? sbet12a / x :
00600           -_f * Math::sq(cbet1) * Math::pi<real>();
00601         lamscale = betscale / cbet1;
00602         y = (lam12 - Math::pi<real>()) / lamscale;
00603       }
00604 
00605       if (y > -tol1_ && x >  -1 - xthresh_) {
00606         // strip near cut
00607         if (_f >= 0) {
00608           salp1 = min(real(1), -real(x)); calp1 = - sqrt(1 - Math::sq(salp1));
00609         } else {
00610           calp1 = max(real(x > -tol1_ ? 0 : -1),  real(x));
00611           salp1 = sqrt(1 - Math::sq(calp1));
00612         }
00613       } else {
00614         // Estimate alp1, by solving the astroid problem.
00615         //
00616         // Could estimate alpha1 = theta + pi/2, directly, i.e.,
00617         //   calp1 = y/k; salp1 = -x/(1+k);  for _f >= 0
00618         //   calp1 = x/(1+k); salp1 = -y/k;  for _f < 0 (need to check)
00619         //
00620         // However, it's better to estimate omg12 from astroid and use
00621         // spherical formula to compute alp1.  This reduces the mean number of
00622         // Newton iterations for astroid cases from 2.24 (min 0, max 6) to 2.12
00623         // (min 0 max 5).  The changes in the number of iterations are as
00624         // follows:
00625         //
00626         // change percent
00627         //    1       5
00628         //    0      78
00629         //   -1      16
00630         //   -2       0.6
00631         //   -3       0.04
00632         //   -4       0.002
00633         //
00634         // The histogram of iterations is (m = number of iterations estimating
00635         // alp1 directly, n = number of iterations estimating via omg12, total
00636         // number of trials = 148605):
00637         //
00638         //  iter    m      n
00639         //    0   148    186
00640         //    1 13046  13845
00641         //    2 93315 102225
00642         //    3 36189  32341
00643         //    4  5396      7
00644         //    5   455      1
00645         //    6    56      0
00646         //
00647         // Because omg12 is near pi, estimate work with omg12a = pi - omg12
00648         real k = Astroid(x, y);
00649         real
00650           omg12a = lamscale * ( _f >= 0 ? -x * k/(1 + k) : -y * (1 + k)/k ),
00651           somg12 = sin(omg12a), comg12 = -cos(omg12a);
00652         // Update spherical estimate of alp1 using omg12 instead of lam12
00653         salp1 = cbet2 * somg12;
00654         calp1 = sbet12a - cbet2 * sbet1 * Math::sq(somg12) / (1 - comg12);
00655       }
00656     }
00657     SinCosNorm(salp1, calp1);
00658     return sig12;
00659   }
00660 
00661   Math::real Geodesic::Lambda12(real sbet1, real cbet1, real sbet2, real cbet2,
00662                                 real salp1, real calp1,
00663                                 real& salp2, real& calp2,
00664                                 real& sig12,
00665                                 real& ssig1, real& csig1,
00666                                 real& ssig2, real& csig2,
00667                                 real& eps, real& domg12,
00668                                 bool diffp, real& dlam12,
00669                                 // Scratch areas of the right size
00670                                 real C1a[], real C2a[], real C3a[]) const
00671     throw() {
00672 
00673     if (sbet1 == 0 && calp1 == 0)
00674       // Break degeneracy of equatorial line.  This case has already been
00675       // handled.
00676       calp1 = -tiny_;
00677 
00678     real
00679       // sin(alp1) * cos(bet1) = sin(alp0)
00680       salp0 = salp1 * cbet1,
00681       calp0 = Math::hypot(calp1, salp1 * sbet1); // calp0 > 0
00682 
00683     real somg1, comg1, somg2, comg2, omg12, lam12;
00684     // tan(bet1) = tan(sig1) * cos(alp1)
00685     // tan(omg1) = sin(alp0) * tan(sig1) = tan(omg1)=tan(alp1)*sin(bet1)
00686     ssig1 = sbet1; somg1 = salp0 * sbet1;
00687     csig1 = comg1 = calp1 * cbet1;
00688     SinCosNorm(ssig1, csig1);
00689     SinCosNorm(somg1, comg1);
00690 
00691     // Enforce symmetries in the case abs(bet2) = -bet1.  Need to be careful
00692     // about this case, since this can yield singularities in the Newton
00693     // iteration.
00694     // sin(alp2) * cos(bet2) = sin(alp0)
00695     salp2 = cbet2 != cbet1 ? salp0 / cbet2 : salp1;
00696     // calp2 = sqrt(1 - sq(salp2))
00697     //       = sqrt(sq(calp0) - sq(sbet2)) / cbet2
00698     // and subst for calp0 and rearrange to give (choose positive sqrt
00699     // to give alp2 in [0, pi/2]).
00700     calp2 = cbet2 != cbet1 || abs(sbet2) != -sbet1 ?
00701       sqrt(Math::sq(calp1 * cbet1) + (cbet1 < -sbet1 ?
00702                                 (cbet2 - cbet1) * (cbet1 + cbet2) :
00703                                 (sbet1 - sbet2) * (sbet1 + sbet2))) / cbet2 :
00704       abs(calp1);
00705     // tan(bet2) = tan(sig2) * cos(alp2)
00706     // tan(omg2) = sin(alp0) * tan(sig2).
00707     ssig2 = sbet2; somg2 = salp0 * sbet2;
00708     csig2 = comg2 = calp2 * cbet2;
00709     SinCosNorm(ssig2, csig2);
00710     SinCosNorm(somg2, comg2);
00711 
00712     // sig12 = sig2 - sig1, limit to [0, pi]
00713     sig12 = atan2(max(csig1 * ssig2 - ssig1 * csig2, real(0)),
00714                   csig1 * csig2 + ssig1 * ssig2);
00715 
00716     // omg12 = omg2 - omg1, limit to [0, pi]
00717     omg12 = atan2(max(comg1 * somg2 - somg1 * comg2, real(0)),
00718                   comg1 * comg2 + somg1 * somg2);
00719     real B312, h0;
00720     real k2 = Math::sq(calp0) * _ep2;
00721     eps = k2 / (2 * (1 + sqrt(1 + k2)) + k2);
00722     C3f(eps, C3a);
00723     B312 = (SinCosSeries(true, ssig2, csig2, C3a, nC3_-1) -
00724             SinCosSeries(true, ssig1, csig1, C3a, nC3_-1));
00725     h0 = -_f * A3f(eps);
00726     domg12 = salp0 * h0 * (sig12 + B312);
00727     lam12 = omg12 + domg12;
00728 
00729     if (diffp) {
00730       if (calp2 == 0)
00731         dlam12 = - 2 * sqrt(1 - _e2 * Math::sq(cbet1)) / sbet1;
00732       else {
00733         real dummy;
00734         Lengths(eps, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00735                 cbet1, cbet2, dummy, dlam12, dummy,
00736                 false, dummy, dummy,  C1a, C2a);
00737         dlam12 /= calp2 * cbet2;
00738       }
00739     }
00740 
00741     return lam12;
00742   }
00743 
00744   Math::real Geodesic::A3f(real eps) const throw() {
00745     // Evaluation sum(_A3c[k] * eps^k, k, 0, nA3x_-1) by Horner's method
00746     real v = 0;
00747     for (int i = nA3x_; i; )
00748       v = eps * v + _A3x[--i];
00749     return v;
00750   }
00751 
00752   void Geodesic::C3f(real eps, real c[]) const throw() {
00753     // Evaluation C3 coeffs by Horner's method
00754     // Elements c[1] thru c[nC3_ - 1] are set
00755     for (int j = nC3x_, k = nC3_ - 1; k; ) {
00756       real t = 0;
00757       for (int i = nC3_ - k; i; --i)
00758         t = eps * t + _C3x[--j];
00759       c[k--] = t;
00760     }
00761 
00762     real mult = 1;
00763     for (int k = 1; k < nC3_; ) {
00764       mult *= eps;
00765       c[k++] *= mult;
00766     }
00767   }
00768 
00769   void Geodesic::C4f(real k2, real c[]) const throw() {
00770     // Evaluation C4 coeffs by Horner's method
00771     // Elements c[0] thru c[nC4_ - 1] are set
00772     for (int j = nC4x_, k = nC4_; k; ) {
00773       real t = 0;
00774       for (int i = nC4_ - k + 1; i; --i)
00775         t = k2 * t + _C4x[--j];
00776       c[--k] = t;
00777     }
00778 
00779     real mult = 1;
00780     for (int k = 1; k < nC4_; ) {
00781       mult *= k2;
00782       c[k++] *= mult;
00783     }
00784   }

00788   // The scale factor A1-1 = mean value of I1-1
00789   Math::real Geodesic::A1m1f(real eps) throw() {
00790     real
00791       eps2 = Math::sq(eps),
00792       t;
00793     switch (nA1_/2) {
00794     case 0:
00795       t = 0;
00796       break;
00797     case 1:
00798       t = eps2/4;
00799       break;
00800     case 2:
00801       t = eps2*(eps2+16)/64;
00802       break;
00803     case 3:
00804       t = eps2*(eps2*(eps2+4)+64)/256;
00805       break;
00806     case 4:
00807       t = eps2*(eps2*(eps2*(25*eps2+64)+256)+4096)/16384;
00808       break;
00809     default:
00810       STATIC_ASSERT(nA1_ >= 0 && nA1_ <= 8, "Bad value of nA1_");
00811       t = 0;
00812     }
00813     return (t + eps) / (1 - eps);
00814   }

00816   // The coefficients C1[l] in the Fourier expansion of B1
00817   void Geodesic::C1f(real eps, real c[]) throw() {
00818     real
00819       eps2 = Math::sq(eps),
00820       d = eps;
00821     switch (nC1_) {
00822     case 0:
00823       break;
00824     case 1:
00825       c[1] = -d/2;
00826       break;
00827     case 2:
00828       c[1] = -d/2;
00829       d *= eps;
00830       c[2] = -d/16;
00831       break;
00832     case 3:
00833       c[1] = d*(3*eps2-8)/16;
00834       d *= eps;
00835       c[2] = -d/16;
00836       d *= eps;
00837       c[3] = -d/48;
00838       break;
00839     case 4:
00840       c[1] = d*(3*eps2-8)/16;
00841       d *= eps;
00842       c[2] = d*(eps2-2)/32;
00843       d *= eps;
00844       c[3] = -d/48;
00845       d *= eps;
00846       c[4] = -5*d/512;
00847       break;
00848     case 5:
00849       c[1] = d*((6-eps2)*eps2-16)/32;
00850       d *= eps;
00851       c[2] = d*(eps2-2)/32;
00852       d *= eps;
00853       c[3] = d*(9*eps2-16)/768;
00854       d *= eps;
00855       c[4] = -5*d/512;
00856       d *= eps;
00857       c[5] = -7*d/1280;
00858       break;
00859     case 6:
00860       c[1] = d*((6-eps2)*eps2-16)/32;
00861       d *= eps;
00862       c[2] = d*((64-9*eps2)*eps2-128)/2048;
00863       d *= eps;
00864       c[3] = d*(9*eps2-16)/768;
00865       d *= eps;
00866       c[4] = d*(3*eps2-5)/512;
00867       d *= eps;
00868       c[5] = -7*d/1280;
00869       d *= eps;
00870       c[6] = -7*d/2048;
00871       break;
00872     case 7:
00873       c[1] = d*(eps2*(eps2*(19*eps2-64)+384)-1024)/2048;
00874       d *= eps;
00875       c[2] = d*((64-9*eps2)*eps2-128)/2048;
00876       d *= eps;
00877       c[3] = d*((72-9*eps2)*eps2-128)/6144;
00878       d *= eps;
00879       c[4] = d*(3*eps2-5)/512;
00880       d *= eps;
00881       c[5] = d*(35*eps2-56)/10240;
00882       d *= eps;
00883       c[6] = -7*d/2048;
00884       d *= eps;
00885       c[7] = -33*d/14336;
00886       break;
00887     case 8:
00888       c[1] = d*(eps2*(eps2*(19*eps2-64)+384)-1024)/2048;
00889       d *= eps;
00890       c[2] = d*(eps2*(eps2*(7*eps2-18)+128)-256)/4096;
00891       d *= eps;
00892       c[3] = d*((72-9*eps2)*eps2-128)/6144;
00893       d *= eps;
00894       c[4] = d*((96-11*eps2)*eps2-160)/16384;
00895       d *= eps;
00896       c[5] = d*(35*eps2-56)/10240;
00897       d *= eps;
00898       c[6] = d*(9*eps2-14)/4096;
00899       d *= eps;
00900       c[7] = -33*d/14336;
00901       d *= eps;
00902       c[8] = -429*d/262144;
00903       break;
00904     default:
00905       STATIC_ASSERT(nC1_ >= 0 && nC1_ <= 8, "Bad value of nC1_");

00909   // The coefficients C1p[l] in the Fourier expansion of B1p
00910   void Geodesic::C1pf(real eps, real c[]) throw() {
00911     real
00912       eps2 = Math::sq(eps),
00913       d = eps;
00914     switch (nC1p_) {
00915     case 0:
00916       break;
00917     case 1:
00918       c[1] = d/2;
00919       break;
00920     case 2:
00921       c[1] = d/2;
00922       d *= eps;
00923       c[2] = 5*d/16;
00924       break;
00925     case 3:
00926       c[1] = d*(16-9*eps2)/32;
00927       d *= eps;
00928       c[2] = 5*d/16;
00929       d *= eps;
00930       c[3] = 29*d/96;
00931       break;

00945       d *= eps;

00947       d *= eps;

00951       break;

00982       d *= eps;

00986       d *= eps;
00987       c[4] = d*(eps2*(1082857*eps2-688608)+258720)/737280;
00988       d *= eps;
00989       c[5] = d*(41604-141115*eps2)/92160;
00990       d *= eps;
00991       c[6] = d*(533134-2200311*eps2)/860160;
00992       d *= eps;
00993       c[7] = 459485*d/516096;
00994       d *= eps;
00995       c[8] = 109167851*d/82575360;
00996       break;
00997     default:
00998       STATIC_ASSERT(nC1p_ >= 0 && nC1p_ <= 8, "Bad value of nC1p_");
00999     }
01000   }
01001 
01002   // The scale factor A2-1 = mean value of I2-1
01003   Math::real Geodesic::A2m1f(real eps) throw() {
01004     real
01005       eps2 = Math::sq(eps),
01006       t;
01007     switch (nA2_/2) {
01008     case 0:
01009       t = 0;
01010       break;
01011     case 1:
01012       t = eps2/4;
01013       break;
01014     case 2:
01015       t = eps2*(9*eps2+16)/64;
01016       break;
01017     case 3:
01018       t = eps2*(eps2*(25*eps2+36)+64)/256;
01019       break;
01020     case 4:
01021       t = eps2*(eps2*(eps2*(1225*eps2+1600)+2304)+4096)/16384;
01022       break;
01023     default:
01024       STATIC_ASSERT(nA2_ >= 0 && nA2_ <= 8, "Bad value of nA2_");
01025       t = 0;
01026     }
01027     return t * (1 - eps) - eps;
01028   }
01029 
01030   // The coefficients C2[l] in the Fourier expansion of B2
01031   void Geodesic::C2f(real eps, real c[]) throw() {
01032     real
01033       eps2 = Math::sq(eps),
01034       d = eps;
01035     switch (nC2_) {
01036     case 0:
01037       break;
01038     case 1:
01039       c[1] = d/2;
01040       break;
01041     case 2:
01042       c[1] = d/2;
01043       d *= eps;
01044       c[2] = 3*d/16;
01045       break;
01046     case 3:
01047       c[1] = d*(eps2+8)/16;
01048       d *= eps;
01049       c[2] = 3*d/16;
01050       d *= eps;
01051       c[3] = 5*d/48;
01052       break;
01053     case 4:
01054       c[1] = d*(eps2+8)/16;
01055       d *= eps;
01056       c[2] = d*(eps2+6)/32;
01057       d *= eps;
01058       c[3] = 5*d/48;
01059       d *= eps;
01060       c[4] = 35*d/512;
01061       break;
01062     case 5:
01063       c[1] = d*(eps2*(eps2+2)+16)/32;
01064       d *= eps;
01065       c[2] = d*(eps2+6)/32;
01066       d *= eps;
01067       c[3] = d*(15*eps2+80)/768;
01068       d *= eps;
01069       c[4] = 35*d/512;
01070       d *= eps;
01071       c[5] = 63*d/1280;
01072       break;
01073     case 6:
01074       c[1] = d*(eps2*(eps2+2)+16)/32;
01075       d *= eps;
01076       c[2] = d*(eps2*(35*eps2+64)+384)/2048;
01077       d *= eps;
01078       c[3] = d*(15*eps2+80)/768;
01079       d *= eps;
01080       c[4] = d*(7*eps2+35)/512;
01081       d *= eps;
01082       c[5] = 63*d/1280;
01083       d *= eps;
01084       c[6] = 77*d/2048;
01085       break;
01086     case 7:
01087       c[1] = d*(eps2*(eps2*(41*eps2+64)+128)+1024)/2048;
01088       d *= eps;
01089       c[2] = d*(eps2*(35*eps2+64)+384)/2048;
01090       d *= eps;
01091       c[3] = d*(eps2*(69*eps2+120)+640)/6144;
01092       d *= eps;
01093       c[4] = d*(7*eps2+35)/512;
01094       d *= eps;
01095       c[5] = d*(105*eps2+504)/10240;
01096       d *= eps;
01097       c[6] = 77*d/2048;
01098       d *= eps;
01099       c[7] = 429*d/14336;
01100       break;
01101     case 8:
01102       c[1] = d*(eps2*(eps2*(41*eps2+64)+128)+1024)/2048;
01103       d *= eps;
01104       c[2] = d*(eps2*(eps2*(47*eps2+70)+128)+768)/4096;
01105       d *= eps;
01106       c[3] = d*(eps2*(69*eps2+120)+640)/6144;
01107       d *= eps;
01108       c[4] = d*(eps2*(133*eps2+224)+1120)/16384;
01109       d *= eps;
01110       c[5] = d*(105*eps2+504)/10240;
01111       d *= eps;
01112       c[6] = d*(33*eps2+154)/4096;
01113       d *= eps;
01114       c[7] = 429*d/14336;
01115       d *= eps;
01116       c[8] = 6435*d/262144;
01117       break;
01118     default:
01119       STATIC_ASSERT(nC2_ >= 0 && nC2_ <= 8, "Bad value of nC2_");
01120     }
01121   }

01123   // The scale factor A3 = mean value of I3
01124   void Geodesic::A3coeff() throw() {
01125     switch (nA3_) {
01126     case 0:
01127       break;
01128     case 1:
01129       _A3x[0] = 1;
01130       break;
01131     case 2:
01132       _A3x[0] = 1;
01133       _A3x[1] = -1/real(2);
01134       break;
01135     case 3:
01136       _A3x[0] = 1;
01137       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01138       _A3x[2] = -1/real(4);
01139       break;
01140     case 4:
01141       _A3x[0] = 1;
01142       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01143       _A3x[2] = (-_n-2)/8;
01144       _A3x[3] = -1/real(16);
01145       break;
01146     case 5:
01147       _A3x[0] = 1;
01148       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01149       _A3x[2] = (_n*(3*_n-1)-2)/8;
01150       _A3x[3] = (-3*_n-1)/16;
01151       _A3x[4] = -3/real(64);
01152       break;
01153     case 6:
01154       _A3x[0] = 1;
01155       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01156       _A3x[2] = (_n*(3*_n-1)-2)/8;
01157       _A3x[3] = ((-_n-3)*_n-1)/16;
01158       _A3x[4] = (-2*_n-3)/64;
01159       _A3x[5] = -3/real(128);
01160       break;
01161     case 7:
01162       _A3x[0] = 1;
01163       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01164       _A3x[2] = (_n*(3*_n-1)-2)/8;
01165       _A3x[3] = (_n*(_n*(5*_n-1)-3)-1)/16;
01166       _A3x[4] = ((-10*_n-2)*_n-3)/64;
01167       _A3x[5] = (-5*_n-3)/128;
01168       _A3x[6] = -5/real(256);
01169       break;
01170     case 8:
01171       _A3x[0] = 1;
01172       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01173       _A3x[2] = (_n*(3*_n-1)-2)/8;
01174       _A3x[3] = (_n*(_n*(5*_n-1)-3)-1)/16;
01175       _A3x[4] = (_n*((-5*_n-20)*_n-4)-6)/128;
01176       _A3x[5] = ((-5*_n-10)*_n-6)/256;
01177       _A3x[6] = (-15*_n-20)/1024;
01178       _A3x[7] = -25/real(2048);
01179       break;
01180     default:
01181       STATIC_ASSERT(nA3_ >= 0 && nA3_ <= 8, "Bad value of nA3_");
01182     }
01183   }

01185   // The coefficients C3[l] in the Fourier expansion of B3
01186   void Geodesic::C3coeff() throw() {
01187     switch (nC3_) {
01188     case 0:
01189       break;
01190     case 1:
01191       break;
01192     case 2:
01193       _C3x[0] = 1/real(4);
01194       break;
01195     case 3:
01196       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01197       _C3x[1] = 1/real(8);
01198       _C3x[2] = 1/real(16);
01199       break;
01200     case 4:
01201       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01202       _C3x[1] = 1/real(8);
01203       _C3x[2] = 3/real(64);
01204       _C3x[3] = (2-3*_n)/32;
01205       _C3x[4] = 3/real(64);
01206       _C3x[5] = 5/real(192);
01207       break;
01208     case 5:
01209       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01210       _C3x[1] = (1-_n*_n)/8;
01211       _C3x[2] = (3*_n+3)/64;
01212       _C3x[3] = 5/real(128);
01213       _C3x[4] = ((_n-3)*_n+2)/32;
01214       _C3x[5] = (3-2*_n)/64;
01215       _C3x[6] = 3/real(128);
01216       _C3x[7] = (5-9*_n)/192;
01217       _C3x[8] = 3/real(128);
01218       _C3x[9] = 7/real(512);
01219       break;
01220     case 6:
01221       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01222       _C3x[1] = (1-_n*_n)/8;
01223       _C3x[2] = ((3-_n)*_n+3)/64;
01224       _C3x[3] = (2*_n+5)/128;
01225       _C3x[4] = 3/real(128);
01226       _C3x[5] = ((_n-3)*_n+2)/32;
01227       _C3x[6] = ((-3*_n-2)*_n+3)/64;
01228       _C3x[7] = (_n+3)/128;
01229       _C3x[8] = 5/real(256);
01230       _C3x[9] = (_n*(5*_n-9)+5)/192;
01231       _C3x[10] = (9-10*_n)/384;
01232       _C3x[11] = 7/real(512);
01233       _C3x[12] = (7-14*_n)/512;
01234       _C3x[13] = 7/real(512);
01235       _C3x[14] = 21/real(2560);
01236       break;
01237     case 7:
01238       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01239       _C3x[1] = (1-_n*_n)/8;
01240       _C3x[2] = (_n*((-5*_n-1)*_n+3)+3)/64;
01241       _C3x[3] = (_n*(2*_n+2)+5)/128;
01242       _C3x[4] = (11*_n+12)/512;
01243       _C3x[5] = 21/real(1024);
01244       _C3x[6] = ((_n-3)*_n+2)/32;
01245       _C3x[7] = (_n*(_n*(2*_n-3)-2)+3)/64;
01246       _C3x[8] = ((2-9*_n)*_n+6)/256;
01247       _C3x[9] = (_n+5)/256;
01248       _C3x[10] = 27/real(2048);
01249       _C3x[11] = (_n*((5-_n)*_n-9)+5)/192;
01250       _C3x[12] = ((-6*_n-10)*_n+9)/384;
01251       _C3x[13] = (21-4*_n)/1536;
01252       _C3x[14] = 3/real(256);
01253       _C3x[15] = (_n*(10*_n-14)+7)/512;
01254       _C3x[16] = (7-10*_n)/512;
01255       _C3x[17] = 9/real(1024);
01256       _C3x[18] = (21-45*_n)/2560;
01257       _C3x[19] = 9/real(1024);
01258       _C3x[20] = 11/real(2048);
01259       break;
01260     case 8:
01261       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01262       _C3x[1] = (1-_n*_n)/8;
01263       _C3x[2] = (_n*((-5*_n-1)*_n+3)+3)/64;
01264       _C3x[3] = (_n*((2-2*_n)*_n+2)+5)/128;
01265       _C3x[4] = (_n*(3*_n+11)+12)/512;
01266       _C3x[5] = (10*_n+21)/1024;
01267       _C3x[6] = 243/real(16384);
01268       _C3x[7] = ((_n-3)*_n+2)/32;
01269       _C3x[8] = (_n*(_n*(2*_n-3)-2)+3)/64;
01270       _C3x[9] = (_n*((-6*_n-9)*_n+2)+6)/256;
01271       _C3x[10] = ((1-2*_n)*_n+5)/256;
01272       _C3x[11] = (69*_n+108)/8192;
01273       _C3x[12] = 187/real(16384);
01274       _C3x[13] = (_n*((5-_n)*_n-9)+5)/192;
01275       _C3x[14] = (_n*(_n*(10*_n-6)-10)+9)/384;
01276       _C3x[15] = ((-77*_n-8)*_n+42)/3072;
01277       _C3x[16] = (12-_n)/1024;
01278       _C3x[17] = 139/real(16384);
01279       _C3x[18] = (_n*((20-7*_n)*_n-28)+14)/1024;
01280       _C3x[19] = ((-7*_n-40)*_n+28)/2048;
01281       _C3x[20] = (72-43*_n)/8192;
01282       _C3x[21] = 127/real(16384);
01283       _C3x[22] = (_n*(75*_n-90)+42)/5120;
01284       _C3x[23] = (9-15*_n)/1024;
01285       _C3x[24] = 99/real(16384);
01286       _C3x[25] = (44-99*_n)/8192;
01287       _C3x[26] = 99/real(16384);
01288       _C3x[27] = 429/real(114688);
01289       break;
01290     default:
01291       STATIC_ASSERT(nC3_ >= 0 && nC3_ <= 8, "Bad value of nC3_");
01292     }
01293   }
